(For those who don�t know, Tavatron is a black and brown wolf. As soon as I 
find a scanner I�ll try and get a pic posted. This post was kindof rushed, 
sorry^_^)

Tavatron knew deep down that something was wrong, but currently she was too 
relieved to be back at base to notice. She had pushed the feeling into the 
very recesses of her mind. Why dwell on the past when the immediate future 
seemed so clear? They were back at base, and as far as she knew they had 
plenty of time to get Dinobot into an �R chamber. There was still the matter 
of her own injuries, but they were nothing compared to his.  She intended to 
help in any way possible, but with her limited knowledge it seemed highly 
unlikely she could do anything but get him to the CR room.

Tavatron stopped short as a sudden movement followed by the sound of Dinobot 
transforming sent a chill down her spine. She automatically turned to face 
the wounded warrior, only to watch him drop to his knees and lose what 
little remained of his fluid. What could have possibly gone wrong? 
Everything had seemed fine only moments ago. Tavatron growled softly as she 
thought, trying to figure out what to do. It figured he wouldn�t let on just 
how injured he was. He had always been too proud a warrior to let anybot 
know just how damaged he truly was. As she continued to ponder his current 
state textual images of possible solutions and probable outcomes sped 
through her internal comp:

I-COMP: Insufficient data� unable to assess problem with unit Dinobot.

The last sentence flashed before her optics for what seemed like an 
eternity. How was it not possible to assess his damage? Her computer was 
limited, but something like this should only take a few nanoseconds to 
analyze. What was she missing? With a frustrated growl Tavatron turned to 
face Dinobot, only to have her vision suddenly blur as her internal screen 
received a message from an unknown sender. The message must have been from 
someone nearby, or else it would have come in over her com.

I-COMP: New data� Reassessing prior findings.

The message was garbled and difficult to understand. It would take at least 
14 cycles for her internal comp to analyze it at its current rate. Dinobot 
may not have that kind of time:

"Internal computer, increase speed."

I-COMP: Danger of further injury to internal systems.

"Increase speed of unit Dinobot�s injuries!"

I-COMP: Increasing.

Tavatron watched as Dinobot slumped to the floor in stasis lock. She turned 
to the only other �bot present (Foxfingers), and did the only thing she 
could think of at the moment, ask for help:

"What�s wrong with him?"

Before he could reply Tavatron contacted IR and told her of their current 
situation. She then turned expectantly to the small fox �bot before her, 
waiting for his answer.
